args:
Surrounded without hope of escape, the prince
is saved when the local villagers rise up to aid
him. Having shown the final trait of the people's
faith, he declares the founding of New Alberia.
*pant* Impressive... You forced my hand.\nPulled the dragon out from within me...
I commend you for the fight you've shown,\nbut look about you.
You are spent. The dragonblood runs dry\nwithin you, and all the world's valor cannot\nmove a body exhausted to its limit.
Meanwhile, I have with me a hundred\nknights elite. What will you do now?
I was that, once. And I admit I was wrong\nto have thought so little of you back then.\nYou are truly brave—even if a traitor.
But if you lack the final qualification,\nyou will die here as a common criminal.
(Forgive me, Notte... Everyone is in your\nhands now.)
(Forgive me, my friends... I really hoped\nto craft our new home together.)
Your feeble rebellion ends here, traitor!
We're surrounded by an army of peasants,\nsir! They're hundreds deep!
We can fight our way free, but not without\ntaking massive casualties!
Oi! You'll not lay one dirty finger on our\n{player_name}, ya scum!
Notte?! I told you to lead the civilians\nAWAY from danger!
Hey, YOU try stopping these people!
As soon as I told 'em the evacuation plan,\nthey all grabbed their garden tools and\ncame running to you!
More are coming by the moment!\nSir, we must retreat!
Dragonblood and the strength to wield it...\nand now the final piece.
Everyone, spread out! ...Elly! Ranzal!\nIf there's any strength left in you,\ndig deep and find it!
Protect the people! I won't return to the\ncastle without every last one of them!
(The traitor prince, purged from the line of\nsuccession...)
(Yet I see clear upon your head the crown\nof light that marks those chosen to lead\nby the people themselves.)
Victory is yours, my brother. This day,\nyou have gained your crown.
I await the next chance we get to cross\nblades, as one who shares the blood of\ndragons.
Hmm? The wind returns to the forest.\nThe Windway stands open once more.
With this, we can erect a dracolith.
It's almost as if this gale howls to\nannounce the rise of a new king.
As if that day has come anew...
Time to declare ourselves a new kingdom,\n{player_name}!
Got a name picked out yet? I'm thinkin'\nRanzalville has a nice ring to it.
Alberia is gone, so maybe we call\nourselves the Mistholt Kingdom?
It's true that Dyrenell put an end to the\nKingdom of Alberia...
But they can't stamp out the ideals on\nwhich it was founded. Our choice for\na new name is clear...
Hear me, my fellow countrymen!\nOur land is small—a narrow thread of\nlight born into a heavy darkness.
Even so, this light will not be extinguished.\nNot as long as the fire of hope burns\nwithin us!
Alberius the Founder left us these wise\nwords: ＂A kingdom does not make a\npeople. A people make a kingdom.＂
We stand here today a people united!\nAnd so, I now claim this as the first day\nin the history of New Alberia!
Long live the king of New Alberia!
We're with you, Your Majesty!\nVio rhyse Alberia!
And so was the small kingdom of New Alberia born\nunder the reign of King {player_name}.
The glint of his crown would in time become a\nlight that sundered Dyrenell's darkness.
A report, Your Imperial Highness.\nWe've received word from a remote patrol.
Apparently, the traitor prince has declared\nsovereignty as ruler of a new kingdom.
Quite the bold move, my dear brother.\n...And?
Worry not, Your Highness. Measures have\nalready been taken to infuse our own\npeople within their numbers.
What's more, I expect his royal siblings\nwill mount their own responses with the\nforces they control.
The great wheel has begun to turn.\nIf he does not take care, he'll soon be\ncrushed beneath it. Heh heh heh...
